00026 /**
00027  *      helper function for revisions_info()
00028  *
00029  *      @param array $a array to compare
00030  *      @param array $b array to compare
00031  *      @return int comparison result
00032  */
00033 function _cmp_time($a, $b)
00034 {
00035         if ($a['time'] == $b['time']) {
00036                 return 0;
00037         }
00038         return ($a['time'] < $b['time']) ? 1 : -1;
00039 }

00042 /**
00043  *      lock an object file
00044  *
00045  *      @param string $name object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00046  *      @param mixed $wait false = give up right away, true = wait until successful, 
00047  *              integer values = wait up to $wait ms
00048  *      @return mixed true (on Win32 for now) or lock handle for success, NULL if 
00049  *              the object doesn't exist, and false if the lock could not be acquired
00050  */
00051 function _obj_lock($name, $wait = true)
00052 {
00053         // TODO (later): make this work on Windows (opening and writing to files 
00054         // after taking the lock doesn't work there atm)
00055         // bandaid below
00056         if (strtoupper(substr(PHP_OS, 0, 3)) === 'WIN') {
00057                 log_msg('warn', 'lock: locking is not supported on WIN32 at the moment');
00058                 return true;
00059         }
00060         
00061         $start = intval(microtime(true)*1000.0);
00062         $fn = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $name);
00063         // resolve symlinks
00064         if (@is_link($fn)) {
00065                 $target = @readlink($fn);
00066                 if (substr($target, 0, 1) == '/') {
00067                         $fn = $target;
00068                 } else {
00069                         $fn = dirname($fn).'/'.$target;
00070                 }
00071                 log_msg('debug', 'lock: resolved '.$name.' -> '.$fn);
00072         }
00073         do {
00074                 $f = @fopen($fn, 'rb');
00075                 if ($f === false) {
00076                         // file does not exist
00077                         log_msg('debug', 'lock: file '.$fn.' does not exist');
00078                         return NULL;
00079                 }
00080                 // try to acquire lock
00081                 if (@flock($f, LOCK_EX|LOCK_NB)) {
00082                         // success
00083                         log_msg('debug', 'lock: acquired lock for '.$name);
00084                         return $f;
00085                 } elseif ($wait === false) {
00086                         // give up right away
00087                         log_msg('debug', 'lock: could not acquire lock');
00088                         return false;
00089                 } elseif (is_int($wait) && $wait < abs(intval(microtime(true)*1000.0)-$start)) {
00090                         // timeout
00091                         log_msg('debug', 'lock: could not acquire lock in '.$wait.'ms');
00092                         return false;
00093                 }
00094                 // sleep for a tenth of a second (not sure if this works)
00095                 usleep(100000);
00096         } while (true);
00097 }
00098

00100 /**
00101  *      unlock an object file
00102  *
00103  *      @param mixed $f lock handle (or anything on Win32)
00104  */
00105 function _obj_unlock($f)
00106 {
00107         // bandaid below
00108         if (strtoupper(substr(PHP_OS, 0, 3)) === 'WIN') {
00109                 log_msg('warn', 'unlock: locking is not supported on WIN32 at the moment');
00110                 return;
00111         }
00112         
00113         if ($f) {
00114                 @flock($f, LOCK_UN);
00115                 log_msg('debug', 'lock: released lock');
00116                 @fclose($f);
00117         }
00118 }

00121 /**
00122  *      create and delete auto- revisions
00123  *
00124  *      this function operates on a specific page and takes SNAPSHOT_MIN_AGE and
00125  *      SNAPSHOT_MAX_AGE into account.
00126  *      @param array $args arguments
00127  *              key 'page' is the page (i.e. page.rev)
00128  *      @return array response
00129  *              true if successful
00130  */
00131 function check_auto_snapshot($args)
00132 {
00133         if (!isset($args['page'])) {
00134                 return response('Required argument "page" missing', 400);
00135         }
00136         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
00137                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 400);
00138         }
00139         
00140         $a = expl('.', $args['page']);
00141         $revs = revisions_info(array('pagename'=>$a[0], 'sort'=>'time'));
00142         $revs = $revs['#data'];
00143         
00144         if ($a[1] == 'head' && SNAPSHOT_MIN_AGE != 0) {
00145                 // we're dealing with a head revision and taking snapshots
00146                 // find the previous auto- revision
00147                 for ($i=0; $i < count($revs); $i++) {
00148                         if (substr($revs[$i]['revision'], 0, 5) == 'auto-') {
00149                                 // got it, check age
00150                                 if (time()-$revs[$i]['time'] < SNAPSHOT_MIN_AGE) {
00151                                         log_msg('debug', 'check_auto_snapshot: age is '.(time()-$revs[$i]['time']).' seconds, not creating a snapshot');
00152                                         break;
00153                                 }
00154                                 // check if different
00155                                 if (dir_is_different(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']), CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $revs[$i]['page']))) {
00156                                         snapshot($args);
00157                                 } else {
00158                                         log_msg('debug', 'check_auto_snapshot: head is identical to '.$revs[$i]['revision'].', not creating a snapshot');
00159                                 }
00160                                 break;
00161                         }
00162                         if ($i == count($revs)-1) {
00163                                 // no auto- revision?, create one now
00164                                 snapshot($args);
00165                         }
00166                 }
00167         }
00168         
00169         // delete old auto- revisions
00170         if (SNAPSHOT_MAX_AGE != 0) {
00171                 for ($i=count($revs)-1; 0 <= $i; $i--) {
00172                         if (substr($revs[$i]['revision'], 0, 5) == 'auto-' && SNAPSHOT_MAX_AGE < time()-$revs[$i]['time']) {
00173                                 log_msg('info', 'check_auto_snapshot: deleting an old snapshot');
00174                                 delete_page(array('page'=>$revs[$i]['page']));
00175                                 $i--;
00176                         }
00177                 }
00178         }
00179         
00180         return response(true);
00181 }
00182 
00183 register_service('glue.check_auto_snapshot', 'check_auto_snapshot', array('auth'=>true));
00184 
00185 
00186 /**
00187  *      duplicate an object
00188  *
00189  *      @param array $args arguments
00190  *              key 'name' name of the object to duplicate
00191  *      @return array response
00192  *              string name of new object if successful
00193  */
00194 function clone_object($args)
00195 {
00196         // load old object
00197         $old = load_object($args);
00198         if ($old['#error']) {
00199                 return $old;
00200         } else {
00201                 $old = $old['#data'];
00202         }
00203         
00204         // create new object
00205         $a = expl('.', $old['name']);
00206         $new = create_object(array('page'=>$a[0].'.'.$a[1]));
00207         if ($new['#error']) {
00208                 return $new;
00209         } else {
00210                 $new = $new['#data'];
00211         }
00212         
00213         // save old object as new
00214         $new = array_merge($old, $new);
00215         $ret = save_object($new);
00216         if ($ret['#error']) {
00217                 return $ret;
00218         } else {
00219                 // return name
00220                 return response($new['name']);
00221         }
00222 }
00223 
00224 register_service('glue.clone_object', 'clone_object', array('auth'=>true));

00226 
00227 /**
00228  *      create an empty object in the content directory
00229  *
00230  *      @param array $args arguments
00231  *              key 'page' is the page (i.e. page.rev)
00232  *      @return array response
00233  *              key 'name' is the name of the object created
00234  */
00235 function create_object($args)
00236 {
00237         if (!isset($args['page'])) {
00238                 return response('Required argument "page" missing', 400);
00239         }
00240         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
00241                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 400);
00242         }
00243         
00244         // try to create new file
00245         $f = false;
00246         $tries = 0;
00247         $mtime = microtime(true);
00248         do {
00249                 // use a finer granularity than unix time by default
00250                 $name = $args['page'].'.'.intval(floor($mtime)).intval(($mtime-floor($mtime))*100.0+$tries);
00251                 $m = umask(0111);
00252                 $f = @fopen(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $name), 'x');
00253                 umask($m);
00254         }
00255         while ($f === false && $tries++ < 9);
00256         
00257         if (!$f) {
00258                 return response('Error creating an object in page '.quot($args['page']), 500);
00259         } else {
00260                 fclose($f);
00261                 log_msg('info', 'create_object: created '.quot($name));
00262                 return response(array('name'=>$name));
00263         }
00264 }
00265 
00266 register_service('glue.create_object', 'create_object', array('auth'=>true));
00267 
00268 
00269 /**
00270  *      create a page
00271  *
00272  *      @param array $args arguments
00273  *              key 'page' is the page (i.e. page.rev)
00274  *      @return array response
00275  */
00276 function create_page($args)
00277 {
00278         if (empty($args['page'])) {
00279                 return response('Required argument "page" missing or empty', 400);
00280         }
00281         if (page_exists($args['page'])) {
00282                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' already exists', 400);
00283         }
00284         if (!valid_pagename($args['page'])) {
00285                 return response('Invalid page name '.quot($args['page']), 400); 
00286         }
00287         
00288         $a = expl('.', $args['page']);  
00289         $d = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0];
00290         if (!is_dir($d)) {
00291                 $m = umask(0000);
00292                 if (!@mkdir($d, 0777)) {
00293                         umask($m);
00294                         return response('Error creating directory '.quot($d), 500);
00295                 }
00296                 umask($m);
00297         }
00298         
00299         $d .= '/'.$a[1];
00300         if (!is_dir($d)) {
00301                 $m = umask(0000);
00302                 if (!@mkdir($d, 0777)) {
00303                         umask($m);
00304                         return response('Error creating directory '.quot($d), 500);
00305                 }
00306                 umask($m);
00307         }
00308 
00309         log_msg('info', 'create_page: created '.quot($args['page']));
00310         invoke_hook('create_page', array('page'=>$args['page']));
00311         return response(true);
00312 }
00313 
00314 register_service('glue.create_page', 'create_page', array('auth'=>true));
00315 register_hook('create_page', 'invoked when a page has been created');
00316 
00317 
00318 /**
00319  *      delete an object from the content directory
00320  *
00321  *      @param array $args arguments
00322  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00323  *      @return array response
00324  */
00325 function delete_object($args)
00326 {
00327         if (empty($args['name'])) {
00328                 return response('Required argument "name" missing or empty', 400);
00329         }
00330         if (!object_exists($args['name'])) {
00331                 return response('Object '.quot($args['name']).' does not exist', 404);
00332         }
00333         // check if the object file is writable
00334         // this allows us to make singular objects read-only by setting the file 
00335         // permissions to 0444 or similar
00336         if (!is_writable(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']))) {
00337                 return response('Object '.quot($args['name']).' is read-only, not deleting it', 500);
00338         }
00339         
00340         // call delete_object unless the object is a symlink
00341         // this is because referenced resources are not part of the current page 
00342         // anyway, and this way it is easier to handle for the modules
00343         $ret = object_get_symlink($args);
00344         $ret = $ret['#data'];
00345         if ($ret === false) {
00346                 $obj = load_object($args);
00347                 if ($obj['#error']) {
00348                         return $obj;
00349                 } else {
00350                         $obj = $obj['#data'];
00351                 }
00352                 invoke_hook('delete_object', array('obj'=>$obj));
00353         }
00354         
00355         if (!@unlink(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']))) {
00356                 return response('Error deleting object '.quot($args['name']), 500);
00357         } else {
00358                 log_msg('info', 'delete_object: deleted '.quot($args['name']));
00359                 // drop the object's page from cache
00360                 $a = expl('.', $args['name']);
00361                 drop_cache('page', $a[0].'.'.$a[1]);
00362                 return response(true);
00363         }
00364 }
00365 
00366 register_service('glue.delete_object', 'delete_object', array('auth'=>true));
00367 register_hook('delete_object', 'invoked when an object is going to be deleted, should be used for deleting referenced resources');
00368 
00369 
00370 /**
00371  *      delete a page
00372  *
00373  *      @param array $args arguments
00374  *              key 'page' is the page (i.e. page.rev)
00375  *      @return array response
00376  */
00377 function delete_page($args)
00378 {
00379         if (empty($args['page'])) {
00380                 return response('Required argument "page" missing or empty', 400);
00381         }
00382         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
00383                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 404);
00384         }
00385         
00386         log_msg('info', 'delete_page: deleting '.quot($args['page']));
00387         invoke_hook('delete_page', array('page'=>$args['page']));
00388         
00389         // TODO (later): make it possible to delete all revisions at once 
00390         // (optimization for frontend)
00391         // TODO (later): how to deal with .svn and .git subdirectories?
00392         // it's objects first
00393         $files = @scandir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']));
00394         foreach ($files as $f) {
00395                 $fn = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']).'/'.$f;
00396                 if ($f == '.' || $f == '..') {
00397                         continue;
00398                 } elseif (substr($f, 0, 1) == '.') {
00399                         // delete .svn directories and the like
00400                         if (!rm_recursive($fn)) {
00401                                 log_msg('error', 'delete_page: error deleting '.quot($fn));
00402                         }
00403                 } elseif (is_link($fn) && !is_file($fn) && !is_dir($fn)) {
00404                         // delete dangling symlinks
00405                         if (!@unlink($fn)) {
00406                                 log_msg('error', 'delete_page: error deleting dangling symlink '.quot($fn));
00407                         }
00408                 } else {
00409                         // and everything else through delete_object
00410                         $ret = delete_object(array('name'=>$args['page'].'.'.$f));
00411                         if ($ret['#error']) {
00412                                 log_msg('error', 'delete_object: '.$ret['#data']);
00413                         }
00414                 }
00415         }
00416         
00417         // then the revision directory
00418         if (!@rmdir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']))) {
00419                 return response('Error deleting page '.$args['page'], 500);
00420         } else {
00421                 log_msg('debug', 'delete_page: deleted '.quot($args['page']));
00422                 // drop the page from cache
00423                 drop_cache('page', $args['page']);
00424         }
00425         
00426         // finally try the shared directory and page directory
00427         $a = expl('.', $args['page']);
00428         @rmdir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0].'/shared');
00429         if (@rmdir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0])) {
00430                 log_msg('info', 'delete_page: parent page directory empty, removing '.quot($a[0]));
00431         }
00432         
00433         return response(true);
00434 }
00435 
00436 register_service('glue.delete_page', 'delete_page', array('auth'=>true));
00437 register_hook('delete_page', 'invoked when a page is going to be deleted');
00438 register_hook('has_reference', 'used for deleting referenced resources');

00441 /**
00442  *      delete a file in the shared directory of a page
00443  *
00444  *      this function only deletes the file when there are no references to it 
00445  *      left. this is not meant to be called directly from the frontend, but 
00446  *      modules should use it when implementing delete_object.
00447  *      @param array $args arguments
00448  *              key 'pagename' is the pagename (i.e. page)
00449  *              key 'file' filename of file in the shared directory
00450  *              key 'max_cnt' delete the file if there are <= max_cnt references (defaults to zero)
00451  *      @return array response
00452  *              true if the file got deleted for good, false if not
00453  */
00454 function delete_upload($args)
00455 {
00456         if (@is_numeric($args['max_cnt'])) {
00457                 $max_cnt = intval($args['max_cnt']);
00458         } else {
00459                 $max_cnt = 0;
00460         }
00461         
00462         $refs = upload_references(array_merge($args, array('stop_after'=>$max_cnt+1)));
00463         if ($refs['#error']) {
00464                 return $refs;
00465         } else {
00466                 $refs = $refs['#data'];
00467         }
00468         
00469         $f = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename'].'/shared/'.$args['file'];
00470         if (count($refs) <= $max_cnt) {
00471                 if (@unlink($f)) {
00472                         log_msg('info', 'delete_upload: deleted '.quot($f));
00473                         // being overly tidy, remove the shared dir if empty
00474                         @rmdir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename'].'/shared');
00475                         return response(true);
00476                 } else {
00477                         return response('Error deleting '.quot($f), 500);
00478                 }
00479         } else {
00480                 log_msg('info', 'delete_upload: not deleting '.quot($f).' because there are still other objects referencing it');
00481                 return response(false);
00482         }
00483 }
00484 
00485 register_service('glue.delete_upload', 'delete_upload', array('auth'=>true));

00495 function get_startpage($args)

00499                 return response($s);
00500         } else {
00501                 return response(DEFAULT_PAGE);
00502         }

00508 /**
00509  *      load an object from the content directory
00510  *
00511  *      @param array $args arguments
00512  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00513  *      @return array response
00514  */
00515 function load_object($args)
00516 {
00517         if (empty($args['name'])) {
00518                 return response('Required argument "name" missing or empty', 400);
00519         }
00520         
00521         // open file for reading
00522         if (($f = @fopen(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']), 'rb')) === false) {
00523                 return response('Error opening '.quot($args['name']).' for reading', 404);
00524         }
00525         
00526         // set the name attribute
00527         // TODO (later): declaring arrays like this is probably unnecessary
00528         $ret = array();
00529         $ret['name'] = $args['name'];
00530         
00531         // read lines and fill object array
00532         $doing_attribs = true;
00533         while (!feof($f)) {
00534                 $l = fgets($f, 4096);
00535                 if ($doing_attribs) {
00536                         // read attributes first
00537                         if (substr($l, -2) == "\r\n") {
00538                                 $l = substr($l, 0, -2);
00539                         } elseif (substr($l, -1) == "\n") {
00540                                 $l = substr($l, 0, -1);
00541                         } elseif (substr($l, -1) == "\r") {
00542                                 $l = substr($l, 0, -1);
00543                         }
00544                         $a = expl(':', $l);
00545                         if (count($a) == 0) {
00546                                 $doing_attribs = false;
00547                         } elseif (count($a) == 1) {
00548                                 // value missing, ignoring
00549                         } else {
00550                                 $ret[$a[0]] = implode(':', array_slice($a, 1));
00551                         }
00552                 } else {
00553                         // content starts after the first empty line
00554                         if (isset($ret['content'])) {
00555                                 $ret['content'] .= $l;
00556                         } else {
00557                                 $ret['content'] = $l;
00558                         }
00559                 }
00560         }
00561         fclose($f);
00562         
00563         // re-set the name attribute (in case it got overwritten)
00564         $ret['name'] = $args['name'];
00565         
00566         return response($ret);
00567 }
00568 
00569 register_service('glue.load_object', 'load_object', array('auth'=>true));
00570 
00571 
00572 /**
00573  *      return the target of an object symlink
00574  *
00575  *      @param array $args arguments
00576  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00577  *      @return array response
00578  *              key '#data' either has the target as object name, an 
00579  *              empty string if the target is outside the content directory or 
00580  *              false if the object is no symlink
00581  */
00582 function object_get_symlink($args)
00583 {
00584         if (empty($args['name'])) {
00585                 return response('Required argument "name" missing or empty', 400);
00586         }
00587         
00588         // TODO (later): think the symlink situation on Windows through
00589         if (is_link(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']))) {
00590                 $f = readlink(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']));
00591                 if (substr($f, 0, 6) != '../../' || substr($f, 6, 2) == '..') {
00592                         log_msg('warn', 'object_get_symlink: target outside of content directory: '.quot($args['name']).' -> '.quot($f));
00593                         return response('');
00594                 } else {
00595                         return response(str_replace('/', '.', substr($f, 6)));
00596                 }
00597         } else {
00598                 return response(false);
00599         }
00600 }
00601 
00602 register_service('glue.object_get_symlink', 'object_get_symlink', array('auth'=>true));
00603 
00604 
00605 /**
00606  *      create a symlink pointing to an object in all other pagename's head revisions
00607  *
00608  *      @param array $args arguments
00609  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00610  *      @return array response
00611  */
00612 function object_make_symlink($args)
00613 {
00614         if (empty($args['name'])) {
00615                 return response('Required argument "name" missing or empty', 400);
00616         }
00617         if (!object_exists($args['name'])) {
00618                 return response('Object '.quot($args['name']).' does not exist', 404);
00619         }
00620 
00621         $a = expl('.', $args['name']);
00622         // see if the object is itself a symlink
00623         $ret = object_get_symlink($args);
00624         $ret = $ret['#data'];
00625         if ($ret !== false && $ret !== '') {
00626                 // create a symlink pointing to the object's target instead
00627                 $target = '../../'.str_replace('.', '/', $ret);
00628                 // skip both the original object's pagename and the new target's pagename
00629                 $a_target = expl('.', $ret);
00630                 $skip_pns = array($a[0], $a_target[0]);
00631         } else {
00632                 $target = '../../'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']);
00633                 $skip_pns = array($a[0]);
00634         }
00635         
00636         $pns = pagenames(array());
00637         $pns = $pns['#data'];
00638         // for every pagename
00639         foreach ($pns as $pn) {
00640                 if (in_array($pn, $skip_pns)) {
00641                         continue;
00642                 }
00643                 // check if the head revision exists
00644                 if (is_dir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$pn.'/head')) {
00645                         $link = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$pn.'/head/'.$a[2];
00646                         if (is_file($link) && !is_link($link)) {
00647                                 // delete objects with the same name
00648                                 // these should have been created when shapshotting and the 
00649                                 // revision has later been reverted to
00650                                 delete_object(array('name'=>$pn.'.head.'.$a[2]));
00651                         } elseif (is_link($link) && !is_file($link) && !is_dir($link)) {
00652                                 // delete dangling symlinks too
00653                                 if (@unlink($link)) {
00654                                         log_msg('info', 'object_make_symlink: deleted dangling symlink '.quot($pn.'.head.'.$a[2]));
00655                                 } else {
00656                                         log_msg('error', 'object_make_symlink: error deleting dangling symlink '.quot($pn.'.head.'.$a[2]));
00657                                 }
00658                         }
00659                                         
00660                         // try to create symlink
00661                         if (@symlink($target, $link)) {
00662                                 log_msg('debug', 'object_make_symlink: '.quot($pn.'.head.'.$a[2]).' -> '.quot($target));
00663                                 // drop the page from cache
00664                                 drop_cache('page', $pn.'.head');
00665                         }
00666                 }
00667         }
00668         
00669         return response(true);
00670 }
00671 
00672 register_service('glue.object_make_symlink', 'object_make_symlink', array('auth'=>true));
00673 
00674 
00675 /**
00676  *      remove one or more attributes from an object in the content directory
00677  *
00678  *      this function takes the object lock.
00679  *      @param array $args arguments
00680  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00681  *              key 'attr' is either a string or an array containing the attribute 
00682  *                      names (keys) to remove
00683  *      @return array response
00684  */
00685 function object_remove_attr($args)
00686 {
00687         if (!isset($args['attr'])) {
00688                 return response('Required argument "attr" missing', 400);
00689         }
00690         
00691         // LOCK
00692         // TODO (later): $args['name'] might not be set
00693         $_l = _obj_lock($args['name'], LOCK_TIME);
00694         if ($_l === false) {
00695                 return response('Could not acquire lock to '.quot($args['name']).' in '.LOCK_TIME.'ms', 500);
00696         }
00697         $obj = load_object($args);
00698         if ($obj['#error']) {
00699                 // UNLOCK
00700                 _obj_unlock($_l);
00701                 return $obj;
00702         } else {
00703                 $obj = $obj['#data'];
00704         }
00705         
00706         if (is_array($args['attr'])) {
00707                 foreach ($args['attr'] as $a) {
00708                         if (isset($obj[$a])) {
00709                                 unset($obj[$a]);
00710                         }
00711                 }
00712         } elseif (is_string($args['attr'])) {
00713                 if (isset($obj[$args['attr']])) {
00714                         unset($obj[$args['attr']]);
00715                 }
00716         } else {
00717                 // UNLOCK
00718                 _obj_unlock($_l);
00719                 return response('Argument "attr" need to be either array or string', 400);
00720         }
00721         
00722         $ret = save_object($obj);
00723         // UNLOCK
00724         _obj_unlock($_l);
00725         return $ret;
00726 }
00727 
00728 register_service('glue.object_remove_attr', 'object_remove_attr', array('auth'=>true));
00729 
00730 
00731 /**
00732  *      return an array of all pagenames in the content directory
00733  *
00734  *      @param array $args unused
00735  *      @return array response
00736  */
00737 function pagenames($args)
00738 {
00739         if (is_dir(CONTENT_DIR)) {
00740                 $files = @scandir(CONTENT_DIR);
00741                 $ret = array();
00742                 foreach ($files as $f) {
00743                         if ($f == '.' || $f == '..' || $f == 'cache' || $f == 'shared') {
00744                                 continue;
00745                         } elseif (!is_dir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$f)) {
00746                                 // skip files
00747                                 continue;
00748                         } elseif (substr($f, 0, 1) == '.') {
00749                                 // skip directories starting with a dot (like .svn)
00750                                 continue;
00751                         } else {
00752                                 $ret[] = $f;
00753                         }
00754                 }
00755                 return response($ret);
00756         } else {
00757                 return response(array());
00758         }
00759 }
00760 
00761 register_service('glue.pagenames', 'pagenames');
00762 
00763 
00764 /**
00765  *      turn an object into an html string
00766  *
00767  *      the function also appends the resulting string to the output in 
00768  *      html.inc.php.
00769  *      @param array $args arguments
00770  *              string 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
00771  *              bool 'edit' are we editing or not
00772  *      @return array response
00773  *              html
00774  */
00775 function render_object($args)
00776 {
00777         // maybe move this to common.inc.php in the future and get rid of some of 
00778         // these checks in the beginning
00779         $obj = load_object($args);
00780         if ($obj['#error']) {
00781                 return $obj;
00782         } else {
00783                 $obj = $obj['#data'];
00784         }
00785         if (!isset($args['edit'])) {
00786                 return response('Required argument "edit" missing', 400);
00787         }
00788         if ($args['edit']) {
00789                 $args['edit'] = true;
00790         } else {
00791                 $args['edit'] = false;
00792         }
00793         
00794         log_msg('debug', 'render_object: rendering '.quot($args['name']));
00795         $ret = invoke_hook_while('render_object', false, array('obj'=>$obj, 'edit'=>$args['edit']));
00796         if (empty($ret)) {
00797                 log_msg('warn', 'render_object: nobody claimed '.quot($obj['name']));
00798                 return response('');
00799         } else {
00800                 $temp = array_keys($ret);
00801                 log_msg('debug', 'render_object: '.quot($obj['name']).' was handled by '.quot($temp[0]));
00802                 $temp = array_values($ret);
00803                 // make sure object has a tailing newline
00804                 if (0 < strlen($temp[0]) && substr($temp[0], -1) != "\n") {
00805                         $temp[0] .= nl();
00806                 }
00807                 body_append($temp[0]);
00808                 // return the element as html-string as well
00809                 return response($temp[0]);
00810         }
00811 }
00812 
00813 register_service('glue.render_object', 'render_object');
00814 register_hook('render_object', 'render an object');
00815 
00816 
00817 /**
00818  *      turn a page into an html string
00819  *
00820  *      the function also appends the resulting string to the output in 
00821  *      html.inc.php.
00822  *      @param array $args arguments
00823  *              key 'page' is the page (i.e. page.rev)
00824  *              key 'edit' are we editing or not
00825  *      @return array response
00826  *              html
00827  */
00828 function render_page($args)
00829 {
00830         // maybe move this to common.inc.php in the future and get rid of some of 
00831         // these checks in the beginning
00832         if (empty($args['page'])) {
00833                 return response('Required argument "page" missing or empty', 400);
00834         }
00835         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
00836                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 404);
00837         }
00838         if (!isset($args['edit'])) {
00839                 return response('Required argument "edit" missing', 400);
00840         }
00841         if ($args['edit']) {
00842                 $args['edit'] = true;
00843         } else {
00844                 $args['edit'] = false;
00845         }
00846         
00847         log_msg('debug', 'render_page: rendering '.quot($args['page']));
00848         $bdy = &body();
00849         elem_add_class($bdy, 'page');
00850         elem_attr($bdy, 'id', $args['page']);
00851         invoke_hook('render_page_early', array('page'=>$args['page'], 'edit'=>$args['edit']));
00852         
00853         // for every file in the page directory
00854         $files = @scandir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']));
00855         foreach ($files as $f) {
00856                 $fn = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']).'/'.$f;
00857                 if ($f == '.' || $f == '..') {
00858                         continue;
00859                 } elseif (is_link($fn) && !is_file($fn) && !is_dir($fn)) {
00860                         // delete dangling symlink
00861                         if (@unlink($fn)) {
00862                                 log_msg('info', 'render_page: deleted dangling symlink '.quot($args['page'].'.'.$f));
00863                         } else {
00864                                 log_msg('error', 'render_page: error deleting dangling symlink '.quot($args['page'].'.'.$f));
00865                         }
00866                         continue;
00867                 }
00868                 // render object
00869                 render_object(array('name'=>$args['page'].'.'.$f, 'edit'=>$args['edit']));
00870         }
00871         
00872         invoke_hook('render_page_late', array('page'=>$args['page'], 'edit'=>$args['edit']));
00873         log_msg('debug', 'render_page: finished '.quot($args['page']));
00874         
00875         // return the body element as html-string as well
00876         return response(elem_finalize($bdy));
00877 }
00878 
00879 register_service('glue.render_page', 'render_page');
00880 register_hook('render_page_early', 'invoked early in the page rendering');
00881 register_hook('render_page_late', 'invoked after the objects have been rendered');
00882 
00883 
00884 /**
00885  *      rename a page
00886  *      @param array $args arguments
00887  *              key 'old' old page (i.e. page1.rev)
00888  *              key 'new' new page (i.e. page2.rev)
00889  *      @return array response
00890  */
00891 function rename_page($args)
00892 {
00893         if (empty($args['old'])) {
00894                 return response('Required argument "old" missing or empty', 400);
00895         }
00896         $pns = pagenames(array());
00897         $pns = $pns['#data'];
00898         if (!in_array($args['old'], $pns)) {
00899                 return response('Page name '.quot($args['old']).' does not exist', 404);
00900         }
00901         if (empty($args['new'])) {
00902                 return response('Required argument "new" missing or empty', 400);
00903         }
00904         if (in_array($args['new'], $pns)) {
00905                 return response('Page name '.quot($args['new']).' already exists', 400);
00906         }
00907         if (!valid_pagename($args['new'].'.head')) {
00908                 return response('Invalid page name '.quot($args['new']), 400);
00909         }
00910         
00911         if (!@rename(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['old'], CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['new'])) {
00912                 return response('Error renaming page '.quot($args['old']).' to '.quot($args['new']), 500);      
00913         } else {
00914                 log_msg('info', 'rename_page: renamed '.quot($args['old']).' to '.quot($args['new']));
00915                 // clean up cache as well
00916                 $revs = revisions(array('pagename'=>$args['new']));
00917                 $revs = $revs['#data'];
00918                 foreach ($revs as $rev) {
00919                         drop_cache('page', $args['old'].'.'.$rev);
00920                 }
00921                 invoke_hook('rename_page', array('pagename'=>$args['new']));
00922                 return response(true);
00923         }
00924 }
00925 
00926 register_service('glue.rename_page', 'rename_page', array('auth'=>true));
00927 register_hook('rename_page', 'invoked when a page has been renamed');
00928 
00929 
00930 /**
00931  *      revert to a specific revision of a page
00932  *
00933  *      this function makes the revision the page's new head revision by copying it.
00934  *      @param array $args arguments
00935  *              key 'page' page to revert to (i.e. page.rev)
00936  *      @return array response
00937  */
00938 function revert($args)
00939 {
00940         if (empty($args['page'])) {
00941                 return response('Required argument "page" missing or empty', 400);
00942         }
00943         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
00944                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 404);
00945         }
00946         $a = expl('.', $args['page']);
00947         if ($a[1] == 'head') {
00948                 return response('Cannot revert to head revision', 400);
00949         }
00950         
00951         log_msg('info', 'revert: reverting to '.quot($args['page']));
00952         
00953         // delete current head revision
00954         // TODO (later): create a snapshot of it before doing so?
00955         if (page_exists($a[0].'.head')) {
00956                 $ret = delete_page(array('page'=>$a[0].'.head'));
00957                 if ($ret['#error']) {
00958                         return $ret;
00959                 }
00960         }
00961         
00962         // create new head revision
00963         $dest = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0].'/head';
00964         $m = umask(0000);
00965         if (!@mkdir($dest, 0777)) {
00966                 umask($m);
00967                 return response('Error creating directory '.quot($dest), 500);
00968         }
00969         umask($m);
00970         
00971         // copy files
00972         $src = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0].'/'.$a[1];
00973         $files = scandir($src);
00974         foreach ($files as $f) {
00975                 if ($f == '.' || $f == '..') {
00976                         continue;
00977                 } elseif (is_file($src.'/'.$f)) {
00978                         // copy file
00979                         $m = umask(0111);
00980                         if (!@copy($src.'/'.$f, $dest.'/'.$f)) {
00981                                 log_msg('error', 'revert: error copying '.quot($src.'/'.$f).' to '.quot($dest.'/'.$f).', skipping file');
00982                         }
00983                         umask($m);
00984                 }
00985         }
00986         
00987         log_msg('info', 'revert: reverted to '.quot($args['page']));
00988         invoke_hook('revert', array('page'=>$args['page']));
00989         
00990         return response(true);
00991 }
00992 
00993 register_service('glue.revert', 'revert', array('auth'=>true));
00994 register_hook('revert', 'invoked after a page has been reverted to');
00995 
00996 
00997 /**
00998  *      return an array of all revisions of a page
00999  *
01000  *      @param array $args arguments
01001  *              key 'pagename' is the pagename (i.e. page)
01002  *      @return array response
01003  */
01004 function revisions($args)
01005 {
01006         if (empty($args['pagename'])) {
01007                 return response('Required argument "pagename" missing or empty', 400);
01008         }
01009         if (!is_dir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename'])) {
01010                 return response('Page name '.quot($args['pagename']).' does not exist', 404);
01011         }
01012         
01013         $files = @scandir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename']);
01014         $ret = array();
01015         foreach ($files as $f) {
01016                 if ($f == '.' || $f == '..' || $f == 'shared') {
01017                         continue;
01018                 } elseif (!is_dir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename'].'/'.$f)) {
01019                         // skip files
01020                         continue;
01021                 } elseif (substr($f, 0, 1) == '.') {
01022                         // skip directories starting with a dot (like .svn)
01023                         continue;
01024                 } else {
01025                         $ret[] = $f;
01026                 }
01027         }
01028         return response($ret);
01029 }
01030 
01031 register_service('glue.revisions', 'revisions');
01032 
01033 
01034 /**
01035  *      return an array with informations about all revisions of a page
01036  *
01037  *      @param array $args arguments
01038  *              key 'pagename' is the pagename (i.e. page)
01039  *              key 'sort' can be either 'time' (descending) or 'name' (ascending, the 
01040  *              default)
01041  *      @return array response
01042  */
01043 function revisions_info($args)
01044 {
01045         $revs = revisions($args);
01046         if ($revs['#error']) {
01047                 return $revs;
01048         }
01049         
01050         $ret = array();
01051         foreach ($revs['#data'] as $r) {
01052                 $d = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename'].'/'.$r;
01053                 $ret[] = array('revision'=>$r, 'time'=>@filemtime($d), 'num_objs'=>count(@scandir($d))-2, 'page'=>$args['pagename'].'.'.$r);
01054         }
01055         
01056         if (isset($args['sort']) && $args['sort'] == 'time') {
01057                 // make head revision always most recent one
01058                 $head = false;
01059                 for ($i=0; $i < count($ret); $i++) {
01060                         if ($ret[$i]['revision'] == 'head') {
01061                                 $head = $ret[$i];
01062                                 array_splice($ret, $i, 1);
01063                                 $i--;
01064                         }
01065                 }
01066                 usort($ret, '_cmp_time');
01067                 if ($head !== false) {
01068                         $ret = array_merge(array($head), $ret);
01069                 }
01070         }
01071         
01072         return response($ret);
01073 }
01074 
01075 register_service('glue.revisions_info', 'revisions_info');
01076 
01077 
01078 /**
01079  *      save an object to the content directory
01080  *
01081  *      use update_object() whenever possible as we want to preserve any object 
01082  *      metadata that is stored in as attributes.
01083  *      @param array $args arguments
01084  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
01085  *              key 'content' is the object's content
01086  *              all other key/value pairs are treated as attributes
01087  *      @return array response
01088  */
01089 function save_object($args)
01090 {
01091         if (empty($args['name'])) {
01092                 return response('Required argument "name" missing or empty', 400);
01093         }
01094         
01095         // open file for writing
01096         $m = umask(0111);
01097         if (($f = @fopen(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['name']), 'wb')) === false) {
01098                 umask($m);
01099                 return response('Error opening '.quot($args['name']).' for writing', 500);
01100         }
01101         umask($m);
01102         
01103         // save attributes
01104         foreach ($args as $key=>$val) {
01105                 if ($key == 'name' || $key == 'content') {
01106                         continue;
01107                 }
01108                 // check for delimiter character in key
01109                 if (strpos($key, ':') !== false) {
01110                         log_msg('warn', 'save_object: skipping attribute '.quot($key).' in object '.quot($args['name']));
01111                         continue;
01112                 }
01113                 // filter newlines from value
01114                 $val = str_replace("\r\n", '', $val);
01115                 $val = str_replace("\n", '', $val);
01116                 $val = str_replace("\r", '', $val);
01117                 fwrite($f, $key.':'.$val."\n");
01118         }
01119         
01120         // save content
01121         if (isset($args['content'])) {
01122                 fwrite($f, "\n");
01123                 fwrite($f, $args['content']);
01124         }
01125         
01126         fclose($f);
01127         // drop the page from cache
01128         // TODO (later): also drop related caches if object is a symlink or target 
01129         // of a symlink
01130         $a = expl('.', $args['name']);
01131         drop_cache('page', $a[0].'.'.$a[1]);
01132         
01133         return response(true);
01134 }
01135 
01136 register_service('glue.save_object', 'save_object', array('auth'=>true));
01137 
01138 
01139 /**
01140  *      save the state of a html element corresponding to an object to disk
01141  *
01142  *      this function takes the object lock.
01143  *      @param array $args arguments
01144  *              key 'html' one html element
01145  *      @return array response
01146  *              true if successful
01147  */
01148 function save_state($args)
01149 {
01150         if (empty($args['html'])) {
01151                 return response('Required argument "html" missing or empty', 400);
01152         }
01153         
01154         require_once('html.inc.php');
01155         require_once('html_parse.inc.php');
01156         
01157         $elem = html_parse_elem($args['html']);
01158         if (!elem_has_class($elem, 'object')) {
01159                 return response('Error saving state as class "object" is not set', 400);
01160         } elseif (!object_exists(elem_attr($elem, 'id'))) {
01161                 return response('Error saving state as object does not exist', 404);
01162         }
01163         
01164         // LOCK
01165         $L = _obj_lock(elem_attr($elem, 'id'), LOCK_TIME);
01166         if ($L === false) {
01167                 return response('Could not acquire lock to '.quot($args['name']).' in '.LOCK_TIME.'ms', 500);
01168         }
01169         $obj = load_object(array('name'=>elem_attr($elem, 'id')));
01170         if ($obj['#error']) {
01171                 // UNLOCK
01172                 _obj_unlock($L);
01173                 return response('Error saving state, cannot load '.quot(elem_attr($elem, 'id')), 500);
01174         } else {
01175                 $obj = $obj['#data'];
01176         }
01177         $ret = invoke_hook_while('save_state', false, array('elem'=>$elem, 'obj'=>$obj));
01178         // UNLOCK
01179         _obj_unlock($L);
01180         if (count($ret) == 0) {
01181                 return response('Error saving state as nobody claimed element', 500);
01182         } else {
01183                 $temp = array_keys($ret);
01184                 log_msg('info', 'save_state: '.quot($obj['name']).' was handled by '.quot($temp[0]));
01185                 return response(true);
01186         }
01187 }
01188 
01189 register_service('glue.save_state', 'save_state', array('auth'=>true));
01190 // modules handling this hook need to make sure that they are not calling 
01191 // either update_object() or object_remove_attr(), but rather save_object() 
01192 // directly
01193 register_hook('save_state', 'save the current state of an object to disk');
01194 
01195 
01196 /**
01197  *      set the startpage
01198  *
01199  *      @param array $args arguments
01200  *              key 'page' is the page (i.e. page.rev)
01201  *      @return array response
01202  *              true if successful
01203  */
01204 function set_startpage($args)
01205 {
01206         if (!isset($args['page'])) {
01207                 return response('Required argument "page" missing', 400);
01208         }
01209         
01210         $m = umask(0111);
01211         if (@file_put_contents(CONTENT_DIR.'/startpage', $args['page']) === false) {
01212                 umask($m);
01213                 return response('Error setting start page', 500);
01214         } else {
01215                 umask($m);
01216                 return response(true);
01217         }
01218 }
01219 
01220 register_service('glue.set_startpage', 'set_startpage', array('auth'=>true));
01221 
01222 
01223 /**
01224  *      create a snapshot from a page
01225  *
01226  *      @param array $args arguments
01227  *              key 'page' page to shapshot (i.e. page.rev)
01228  *              key 'rev' (optional) new revision name (i.e. rev2) (if empty or not set 
01229  *                      a revision starting with 'auto-' and the current date will be 
01230  *                      created)
01231  *      @return array response (holding the page of the newly created revision 
01232  *              if successful)
01233  */
01234 function snapshot($args)
01235 {
01236         if (empty($args['page'])) {
01237                 return response('Required argument "page" missing or empty', 400);
01238         }
01239         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
01240                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 404);
01241         }
01242         // setup revision name
01243         $a = expl('.', $args['page']);
01244         if (empty($args['rev'])) {
01245                 $args['rev'] = 'auto-'.date('YmdHis');
01246         } elseif (page_exists($a[0].'.'.$args['rev'])) {
01247                 return response('Revision '.quot($args['rev']).' already exists', 400);
01248         } elseif (!valid_pagename($a[0].'.'.$args['rev'])) {
01249                 return response('Invalid revision '.quot($args['rev']), 400);
01250         }
01251         
01252         // create revision
01253         $dest = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0].'/'.$args['rev'];
01254         $m = umask(0000);
01255         if (!@mkdir($dest)) {
01256                 umask($m);
01257                 return response('Error creating directory '.quot($dest), 500);
01258         }
01259         umask($m);
01260         
01261         // copy files
01262         // we go through the files one by one in order to spot symlinks hiding
01263         $src = CONTENT_DIR.'/'.str_replace('.', '/', $args['page']);
01264         $files = scandir($src);
01265         foreach ($files as $f) {
01266                 if ($f == '.' || $f == '..') {
01267                         continue;
01268                 } elseif (is_dir($src.'/'.$f) && substr($f, 0, 1) == '.') {
01269                         // skip directories that start with a dot (like .svn) without a warning
01270                         continue;
01271                 } elseif (is_dir($src.'/'.$f)) {
01272                         log_msg('warn', 'snapshot: skipping '.quot($src.'/'.$f).' as we don\'t support directories inside pages');
01273                 } elseif (is_link($src.'/'.$f) && is_file($src.'/'.$f)) {
01274                         // a proper symlink, copy content
01275                         $s = @file_get_contents($src.'/'.$f);
01276                         $m = umask(0111);
01277                         if (!@file_put_contents($dest.'/'.$f, $s)) {
01278                                 log_msg('error', 'snapshot: error writing to '.quot($dest.'/'.$f). ', skipping file');
01279                         } else {
01280                                 log_msg('debug', 'snapshot: copied the content of symlink '.quot($args['page'].'.'.$f));
01281                         }
01282                         umask($m);
01283                         // load the newly created snapshot and give modules a chance to 
01284                         // copy referenced files as well
01285                         $dest_name = $a[0].'.'.$args['rev'].'.'.$f;
01286                         $dest_obj = load_object(array('name'=>$dest_name));
01287                         if ($dest_obj['#error']) {
01288                                 log_msg('error', 'snapshot: error loading snapshotted object '.quot($dest_name).', skipping hook');
01289                         } else {
01290                                 $dest_obj = $dest_obj['#data'];
01291                                 // get the source object's target
01292                                 $src_name = $args['page'].'.'.$f;
01293                                 $src_target = object_get_symlink(array('name'=>$src_name));
01294                                 if ($src_target['#error']) {
01295                                         log_msg('error', 'snapshot: error getting the symlink target of source object '.quot($src_name).', skipping hook');
01296                                 } else {
01297                                         $src_target = $src_target['#data'];
01298                                         // hook
01299                                         invoke_hook('snapshot_symlink', array('obj'=>$dest_obj, 'origin'=>implode('.', array_slice(expl('.', $src_target), 0, 2))));
01300                                 }
01301                         }
01302                 } elseif (is_file($src.'/'.$f)) {
01303                         // copy file
01304                         $m = umask(0111);
01305                         if (!@copy($src.'/'.$f, $dest.'/'.$f)) {
01306                                 log_msg('error', 'snapshot: error copying '.quot($src.'/'.$f).' to '.quot($dest.'/'.$f).', skipping file');
01307                         }
01308                         umask($m);
01309                 }
01310         }
01311         
01312         log_msg('info', 'snapshot: created snapshot '.quot($a[0].'.'.$args['rev']).' from '.quot($args['page']));
01313         return response($a[0].'.'.$args['rev']);
01314 }
01315 
01316 register_service('glue.snapshot', 'snapshot', array('auth'=>true));
01317 register_hook('snapshot_symlink', 'invoked when a symlink is part of a page that gets snapshotted; the module in question is supposed to copy all referenced files to the shared directory of the destination page');
01318 
01319 
01320 /**
01321  *      update an object
01322  *
01323  *      this function merges the attributes in $args with the object already on 
01324  *      disk. the object need not exist before, though.
01325  *      this function takes the object lock.
01326  *      @param array $args arguments
01327  *              key 'name' is the object name (i.e. page.rev.obj)
01328  *              key 'content' is the object's content
01329  *              all other key/value pairs are treated as attributes
01330  *      @return array response
01331  */
01332 function update_object($args)
01333 {
01334         if (empty($args['name'])) {
01335                 return response('Required argument "name" missing or empty', 400);
01336         }
01337         
01338         // LOCK
01339         $L = _obj_lock($args['name'], LOCK_TIME);
01340         // the object need not exist, so we're not checking against 
01341         // $L being NULL here
01342         if ($L === false) {
01343                 return response('Could not acquire lock to '.quot($args['name']).' in '.LOCK_TIME.'ms', 500);
01344         }
01345         $old = load_object($args);
01346         if ($old['#error']) {
01347                 $old = array();
01348         } else {
01349                 $old = $old['#data'];
01350         }
01351         $new = array_merge($old, $args);
01352         
01353         $ret = save_object($new);
01354         // UNLOCK
01355         _obj_unlock($L);
01356         return $ret;
01357 }
01358 
01359 register_service('glue.update_object', 'update_object', array('auth'=>true));
01360 
01361 
01362 /**
01363  *      upload one or more files
01364  *
01365  *      @param array $args arguments
01366  *              key 'page' page to upload the files to (i.e. page.rev)
01367  *              key 'preferred_module' (optional) try first to invoke the upload method 
01368  *                      on this module
01369  *      @return array response
01370  *              array of rendered, newly created objects
01371  */
01372 function upload_files($args)
01373 {
01374         if (empty($args['page'])) {
01375                 return response('Required argument "page" missing or empty', 400);
01376         }
01377         if (!page_exists($args['page'])) {
01378                 return response('Page '.quot($args['page']).' does not exist', 404);
01379         }
01380         
01381         $ret = array();
01382         
01383         log_msg('debug', 'upload_files: $_FILES is '.var_dump_inl($_FILES));
01384         foreach ($_FILES as $f) {
01385                 $existed = false;
01386                 $fn = upload_file($f['tmp_name'], $args['page'], $f['name'], $existed);
01387                 if ($fn === false) {
01388                         continue;
01389                 } else {
01390                         $args = array_merge($args, array('file'=>$fn, 'mime'=>$f['type'], 'size'=>$f['size']));
01391                         // clear mime type if set to default application/octet-stream
01392                         if ($args['mime'] == 'application/octet-stream') {
01393                                 $args['mime'] = '';
01394                         }
01395                 }
01396                 $s = false;
01397                 // check preferred_module first
01398                 if (!empty($args['preferred_module'])) {
01399                         // make sure all modules are loaded
01400                         load_modules();
01401                         $func = $args['preferred_module'].'_upload';
01402                         if (is_callable($func)) {
01403                                 log_msg('debug', 'upload_files: invoking hook upload, calling '.$func);
01404                                 $s = $func($args);
01405                                 if ($s !== false) {
01406                                         log_msg('info', 'upload_object: '.quot($fn).' was handled by '.quot($args['preferred_module']));
01407                                 }
01408                         }
01409                 }
01410                 // check all other modules next
01411                 if ($s === false) {
01412                         $r = invoke_hook_while('upload', false, $args);
01413                         if (count($r) == 1) {
01414                                 $s = array_pop(array_values($r));
01415                                 log_msg('info', 'upload_object: '.quot($fn).' was handled by '.quot(array_pop(array_keys($r))));
01416                         }
01417                 }
01418                 // check fallback hook last
01419                 if ($s === false) {
01420                         $r = invoke_hook_while('upload_fallback', false, $args);
01421                         if (count($r) == 1) {
01422                                 $s = array_pop(array_values($r));
01423                                 log_msg('info', 'upload_object: '.quot($fn).' was (fallback-) handled by '.quot(array_pop(array_keys($r))));
01424                         }
01425                 }
01426                 
01427                 if ($s === false) {
01428                         log_msg('warn', 'upload_files: nobody cared about file '.quot($fn).', type '.$f['type']);
01429                         // delete file again unless it did already exist
01430                         if (!$existed) {
01431                                 $a = expl('.', $args['page']);
01432                                 @unlink(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$a[0].'/shared/'.$fn);
01433                         }
01434                 } else {
01435                         $ret[] = $s;
01436                 }
01437         }
01438         
01439         return response($ret);
01440 }
01441 
01442 register_service('glue.upload_files', 'upload_files', array('auth'=>true));
01443 
01444 
01445 /**
01446  *      list all objects referencing a certain file in the shared directory
01447  *
01448  *      @param array $args arguments
01449  *              key 'pagename' is the pagename (i.e. page)
01450  *              key 'file' filename of file in the shared directory
01451  *              key 'stop_after' n references
01452  *      @return array response
01453  *              array of objects (i.e. page.rev.obj)
01454  */
01455 function upload_references($args)
01456 {
01457         $revs = revisions($args);
01458         if ($revs['#error']) {
01459                 return $revs;
01460         } else {
01461                 $revs = $revs['#data'];
01462         }
01463         if (empty($args['file'])) {
01464                 return response('Required argument "file" missing or empty', 400);
01465         }
01466         // this is an optimization for delete_upload()
01467         if (@is_numeric($args['stop_after'])) {
01468                 $stop_after = intval($args['stop_after']);
01469         } else {
01470                 $stop_after = 0;
01471         }
01472         
01473         $ret = array();
01474         
01475         // for each revision
01476         foreach ($revs as $rev) {
01477                 // load all objects
01478                 $files = @scandir(CONTENT_DIR.'/'.$args['pagename'].'/'.$rev);
01479                 foreach ($files as $f) {
01480                         if ($f == '.' || $f == '..') {
01481                                 continue;
01482                         }
01483                         $obj = load_object(array('name'=>$args['pagename'].'.'.$rev.'.'.$f));
01484                         if ($obj['#error']) {
01485                                 continue;
01486                         } else {
01487                                 $obj = $obj['#data'];
01488                         }
01489                         // and handle the object to our modules
01490                         log_msg('debug', 'upload_references: checking '.quot($obj['name']));
01491                         $revs = invoke_hook_while('has_reference', false, array('file'=>$args['file'], 'obj'=>$obj));
01492                         if (count($revs)) {
01493                                 $ret[] = $args['pagename'].'.'.$rev.'.'.$f;
01494                                 if (count($ret) == $stop_after) {
01495                                         // return prematurely
01496                                         return response($ret);
01497                                 }
01498                         }
01499                 }
01500         }
01501         
01502         return response($ret);
01503 }
01504 
01505 register_service('glue.upload_references', 'upload_references', array('auth'=>true));
01506 register_hook('has_reference', 'check if an object references an uploaded file');
Generated on Tue May 17 2011 14:19:32 for hotglue by  1.7.3
